title: Labour says Farage would revive austerity as he prepares to set out economic vision in speech – UK politics live
summary: Reform UK leader is set to announce plans for deregulation and spending cuts amid criticism from Labour and Conservative parties. Both opposition parties are raising concerns about the implications of these proposed policies. The announcement is anticipated to intensify the political debate surrounding economic management.

title: ‘I can’t go on anymore’: Mazón resigns as Valencia leader and acknowledges mistakes during deadly 2024 floods – Europe live
summary: In October 2024, flooding resulted in the deaths of 229 people, leading to intense public pressure for Mazón's resignation. The tragedy sparked widespread criticism of his handling of the disaster response. Mazón faced daily demands for accountability as the crisis unfolded.

title: UK factory output returns to growth after JLR restarts operations after cyber-attack – business live
summary: OPEC+ has decided to halt any increases in oil production beyond December due to concerns about a potential oversupply in the market. This decision comes as the global economic outlook remains uncertain. The move aims to stabilize oil prices amid rising crude inventory levels.

title: UK economy ‘doomed’ under Labour, says Ryanair chief
summary: Michael O’Leary asserts that Rachel Reeves should implement tax cuts to foster economic growth, coinciding with Ryanair's impressive 42% increase in profits during the first half of the year.

title: How the European convention on human rights became a battleground between the centre and the right | Daniel Trilling
summary: Daniel Trilling highlights that for two decades, populists in the UK have criticized the European Court of Human Rights (ECHR) for allegedly jeopardizing national security by providing fundamental protections to immigrants. This narrative has influenced public perceptions and political discourse surrounding immigration and human rights. The ongoing debate underscores a conflict between protecting individual rights and addressing populist concerns over national sovereignty.
